channel.title: I kinda need an expert
channel.description:
So, I have a source that has all the gs stances working and the 2h stance is correct as well. The bad thing was that the emotes for clap dance bow etc weren't set in clickingmost.
I need some help, because when I added the emotes in clickingmost for the tabs every server has, the emotes ids were used for the gs stances and attacks. How can I modify that, or where can I find the source's emotes ids?

item.title: I kinda need an expert
item.dc:creator: @daved daved
item.description:
@daved wrote:

Which is the folder with the emotes in the client side because the class 23 isn’t.

Woa, this is getting messy.

Read full topic

item.title: I kinda need an expert
item.dc:creator: @Vexx Vexx
item.description:
@Vexx wrote:

in clientside open class 23.java(or the one with emotes) and chage the emotes for the spec’s and emotes to emotes like agility like right now the sgs spec is 321 you change it to an agility emote n the emote list that kingen50cent posted.

Read full topic

item.title: I kinda need an expert
item.dc:creator: @daved daved
item.description:
@daved wrote:

sounds tough… Thanks for helping though, I’ll try everything I can.

Read full topic

item.title: I kinda need an expert
item.dc:creator: @Spades Spades
item.description:
@Spades wrote:

Kingen50cent:

Yeah then search for it in your clickingmost.java and EDIT ITS ID TO THE REAL ID WHICH IS IN YOUR EMOTE ID LIST! ITS NOT HARD TO UNDERSTAND!

His problem is, that when the Gs Stances were added in they overwrote the gfx for the emotes he is missing.
I had this problem, I took out the Gs Stances, there are dumb stanses you can add, like the original stance(dh axe stance) but that’s about it.
You would have to code an emote from scratch and make a whole new thing for it. Which I have no idea how to do so, it can be done since Jagex did it, just do trial and error with your efforts.

Read full topic

item.title: I kinda need an expert
item.dc:creator: @Kingen50cent Kingen50cent
item.description:
@Kingen50cent wrote:

[quote=“licorish55, post:10, topic:322760”]Kingen you’re over complicating this.

He is saying, when he set the new emotions to replace the old ones, they instead replaced the godsword stances.[/quote]
Oh lol now i understand sorry.

item.title: I kinda need an expert
item.dc:creator: @Kingen50cent Kingen50cent
item.description:
@Kingen50cent wrote:

Try looking at an another source’s CLickingMost file and try to correct your ClickingMost(OPTIONAL LOL)
--------Now to fix it read this:
First off look at your clickingmost file
Search for example “Yes emote” or whatever its name is
Then in there you will need to edit the emote id to the real “Yes” Emote ID
By looking at your emote id, and then repeat for the other emotes.

P.S www.netbeans.org is a good help

Read full topic
